TopicTitle: I have a kerbal down, on the moon.

Articles.Content:
Guys, I went on EVA from the lander but was knocked out. And now, after 16 days, have not moved.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]31994[/ATTACH]
He doesn't get up until you press one of the WSAD keys.
iCharles, he should get up if you select him as the active flight and use WASD, or failing that, press R to activate his jet pack, and he should move
Yep, what Vager said. Select him as flight from tracking center, and just activate your RCS with the R key, he should flip out of there trying to right himself

none of that **** worked guys! he was knocked out leaning over a fuel tank, so I thought that was the problem. I launched a rescue mission, knocked him off the tank with another brave kerbonaut, and that fixed it.
Sounds like he was stuck between the pieces. When you knocked him off he became unstuck.
maybe he landed just right so the game thought he was still falling.
This screenshot that you've uploaded is just hillarious. Lazy kerbal:)
I've had similar troubles with kerbals not being able to get up when the fall while standing on a part, but quitting and reloading the game usually fixes it...
Well, I will try and avoid such mishaps in the future, yet I think I will face even dafter ones now I use a skycrane.
